intro: Stylidium validum, commonly known as the sticky false heather, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces a sticky substance from its glandular hairs, which helps in seed dispersal by attaching to the fur of animals. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathland environments. Stylidium validum is a perennial herb that is well adapted to the dry and nutrient-poor conditions of its native habitat.
